command.name: create

help.short: The load balancer name.
The name of the frontend IP configuration.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
Static private IP address to associate with the configuration.
The Private IP allocation method.
Gets the provisioning state of the public IP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.
Name or ID of the existing public IP to associate with the configuration.
The resource GUID property of the public IP resource.
Resource ID.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
dns settings

The domain name label. The concatenation of the domain name label and the regionalized DNS zone make up the fully qualified domain name associated with the public IP address. If a domain name label is specified, an A DNS record is created for the public IP in the Microsoft Azure DNS system.
The Fully Qualified Domain Name of the A DNS record associated with the public IP. This is the concatenation of the domainNameLabel and the regionalized DNS zone.

The reverse FQDN. A user-visible, fully qualified domain name that resolves to this public IP address. If the reverseFqdn is specified, then a PTR DNS record is created pointing from the IP address in the in-addr.arpa domain to the reverse FQDN.
idle timeout in minutes
The provisioning state of the PublicIP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

help.short: The load balancer name.
The name of the resource that is unique within the set of inbound NAT pools used by the load balancer. This name can be used to access the resource.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 1 and 65535.
The name or ID of the frontend IP configuration.
The last port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65535.
The first port number in the range of external ports that will be used to provide Inbound Nat to NICs associated with a load balancer. Acceptable values range between 1 and 65534.
The reference to the transport protocol used by the inbound NAT pool.
Gets the provisioning state of the PublicIP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

help.short: The load balancer name.
The name of the resource that is unique within the set of inbound NAT rules used by the load balancer.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The port used for the internal endpoint. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65535.

Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.
The name of ID of the frontend IP configuration.
The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values range from 1 to 65534.
The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.
The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule.
Gets the provisioning state of the public IP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.

help.short: The load balancer name.
The name of the probe.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The interval, in seconds, for how frequently to probe the endpoint for health status.
help.lines: Typically, the interval is slightly less than half the allocated timeout period (in seconds) which allows two full probes before taking the instance out of rotation. The default value is 15, the minimum value is 5.

help.short: The number of consecutive probe failures before an instance is deemed unhealthy.
help.lines: This values allows endpoints to be taken out of rotation faster or slower than the typical times used in Azure.

help.short: The port for communicating the probe. Possible values range from 1 to 65535, inclusive.
The protocol of the end point.
help.lines: If 'Tcp' is specified, a received ACK is required for the probe to be successful. If 'Http' or 'Https' is specified, a 200 OK response from the specifies URI is required for the probe to be successful.

help.short: Gets the provisioning state of the public IP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.
The URI used for requesting health status from the VM. Path is required if a protocol is set to http. Otherwise, it is not allowed.

help.short: The load balancer name.
The name of the load balancing rule.
A unique read-only string that changes whenever the resource is updated.
Resource ID.
The name or ID of the backend address pool
The port used for internal connections on the endpoint. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65535. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".

Configures a virtual machine's endpoint for the floating IP capability required to configure a SQL AlwaysOn Availability Group. This setting is required when using the SQL AlwaysOn Availability Groups in SQL server. This setting can't be changed after you create the endpoint.
The name of ID of the frontend IP configuration.
The port for the external endpoint. Port numbers for each rule must be unique within the Load Balancer. Acceptable values are between 0 and 65534. Note that value 0 enables "Any Port".
The timeout for the TCP idle connection. The value can be set between 4 and 30 minutes. The default value is 4 minutes. This element is only used when the protocol is set to TCP.
The load distribution policy for this rule.
The ID or Name of an existing probe to associate with this rule.
The reference to the transport protocol used by the load balancing rule.
Gets the provisioning state of the PublicIP resource. Possible values are: 'Updating', 'Deleting', and 'Failed'.
